New Records: Quinton de Kock slammed the highest score so far in the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023 with 174 runs.
Key Match Events: Quinton de Kock scored 174 from 140 balls, including 22 boundaries.
Heinrich Klaasen scored 90 from 49 balls, including eight sixes.
Mahmudullah scored a run-a-ball 111 for Bangladesh.
Mehidy Hasan Miraz trapped Rassie van de Dussen leg before.
Marco Jansen removed Tanzid Hasan and Najmul Hossain Shanto in consecutive deliveries.
Gerald Coetzee removed Mushfiqur Rahim for 8.
Kagiso Rabada trapped Litton Das leg before for 22.
Keshav Maharaj had Mehidy Hasan Miraz caught in the deep for 11.
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa was led by Aiden Markram in the absence of Temba Bavuma.
Shakib Al Hasan returned to the Bangladesh squad, replacing Towhid Hridoy.
Shakib Al Hasan mentioned he didn't mind bowling first to restrict South Africa to a reasonable total.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa's victory sent them to second in the table with the best net run rate among all ten teams.
Bangladesh slipped below England to the foot of the standings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa's innings was assisted by a dropped chance in the second over when Tanzid Hasan dropped a nick from Reeza Hendricks.
South Africa's pacers replicated their performance against England, showing top form against Bangladesh.
